query.prompt:
For each row in the table, look up the etymology of the word. In the "Derived" column, write Old English, Old French, Latin, Greek, etc. In the "Etymology" column, fill in the corresponding word in Greek, Latin, or others, but leave blank if unknown.
| English | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | and | | | | the | | | | cliff | | | | be | | | | descend | | | | over | | | | there | | | | beyond | | |
query.result:
| English | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | and | Old English | and | | the | Old English | ðe | | cliff | Old English | clif | | be | Old English | bēon | | descend | Latin | descendere | | over | Old English | ofer | | there | Old English | ðær | | beyond | Old English | begeondan |
Please note that the etymology of "cliff" is uncertain, but it is thought to be derived from an Old English word meaning "to cleave" or "to split".
